total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern in the input grid. The pattern seems to be a repeating sequence of numbers (1, 2, 5, 1, 8, 2, 1) in each row with some variations.
Q2: Identify the locations of the zeros in the input grid. The zeros seem to be replacing some of the numbers in the sequence.
Q3: Determine the rule for replacing the numbers with zeros. It seems that the zeros are replacing the numbers in the sequence starting from the 19th column and continuing to the 23rd column.
Q4: Apply the same rule to the quiz input grid to generate the output grid.

Q1: Identify the pattern in the input grid. The pattern seems to be a repeating sequence of numbers (1, 2, 5, 1, 8, 2, 1) in each row, with some rows having a sequence of zeros in the middle.
Q2: Determine the rule for when the sequence of zeros appears in a row. It seems to appear in every 7th row starting from the 11th row.
Q3: Identify the rule for the transformation from the input grid to the output grid. In the examples, the output grid is identical to the input grid.
Q4: Apply the identified rules to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
